definition: to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to rack one's brains/to think hard

sentences.english: Many students in the course of employment because of their dedicated and halfheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多学生因为求职过程的劳心劳力而对其敷衍了事。

sentences.english: He beat his brains over the matter for days.
sentences.chinese: 他为这个问题劳心焦思了好些天。

sentences.english: At least we don't have to worry about Harbour Pointe any more.
sentences.chinese: 起码来说，我们不必再为波因特港工程劳心费力。

definition: to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned

to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
taxing (mentally or emotionally)
to work hard/to look after
to toil/hard work
to work hard/to toil
to worry about
tired/exhausted/worn out/to toil
to worry/to be on one's mind
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
concerned/troubled/having sth on one's mind
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
